newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Ukhta Refinery seeks place on share list.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Ukhta Refinery seeks place on share list.

text.p: Ukhta Refinery is currently preparing documents to have its shares included on a new list of shares of Russian companies meeting tough disclosure requirements, a leading shareholder said on Wednesday.

Investment company OLMA, whose representative sits on the refinery's board, said in a statement Ukhta was transferring custody of its shareholder's register to the Moscow Stock Centre, which would also facilitate inclusion on the new list.
Ukhta previously ran its own share register.

The Federal Commission for the Securities Market has drawn up rules for inclusion on two lists of shares, traded on the RTS and other exchanges. Companies included in the level-one list must meet special disclosure rules and other requirements.
The Russian authorities are keen to develop independent share registers to make the market more transparent.

Last week the national brokers association NAUFOR said the lists could be ready by May. The level-one list is likely to include retailers GUM and TsUM, regional telecoms company Uralsvyazinform and oil producer Chernogorneft.

RTS already operates two segments for shares. Leading shares are traded on the main RTS system, and less liquid stocks on the new RTS-2 market. Ukhtinsky Neftepererabatayushchy Zavod (Ukhta) trades on RTS-2.
Oil holding company KomiTEK owns 38 percent of the refinery's shares. The refinery processed 2.52 million tonnes of crude oil in 1996, 32 percent higher than in 1995.
